  • Constructor Details

    • OptionGeneratorCollection

      public OptionGeneratorCollection()

  • Method Details

    • generateConfirmOptions

      public static List<Option> generateConfirmOptions(FunctionalInterfaces.NextAction<Exception> nextAction, MenuState nextState, MenuState exitState)
      Generates a list of confirmation options, allowing users to confirm or cancel an action. This method acts as a middleware option generator that accepts the specific actions and menu states to use for each confirmation choice, allowing for flexibility in various workflows.

      The generated options include:

      • Yes Option (confirm): Sets the nextAction and transitions to nextState.
      • No Option (cancel): Returns to the exitState without modifying form data.
      Each option is unnumbered, with "Y" and "N" as selectors for confirmation and cancellation, respectively.
      Parameters:
      nextAction - The action to execute when the "Yes" option is selected.
      nextState - The menu state to navigate to after confirming.
      exitState - The menu state to navigate to if canceled.
      Returns:
      A list containing "Yes" and "No" options for confirmation and cancellation.

    • generateLogoutAndExitOptions

      public static List<Option> generateLogoutAndExitOptions()
      Generates a list of options for logging out or exiting the application, often appended to existing option menus.

      The generated options include:

      • Logout Option ("LO"): Logs the user out and navigates back to the login screen.
      • Exit Option ("E"): Exits the application, throwing an ExitApplication exception.
      Each option is unnumbered and provides a concise selection pattern for easy access.
      Returns:
      A list containing logout and exit options.

    • generateMainMenuOption

      public static List<Option> generateMainMenuOption()
      Generates an option for returning to the main menu, often appended to existing option menus.

      The generated option allows users to select "Main Menu" or "M" to navigate back to their respective main menu state.

      • Main Menu Option ("M"): Navigates back to the main menu for the current user.
      Additional options can be added to this list if needed.
      Returns:
      A list containing the main menu option.

    • generateResetPasswordOption

      public static Option generateResetPasswordOption()
      Generates an option for users to reset their password.

      This option allows users to navigate to the password reset process, which leads to the MenuState.LOGIN_PASSWORD state for further password-related actions. The option is designed as a numbered choice, making it easily selectable in a menu.

      Returns:
      An Option object configured for the password reset action, with a transition to the login password menu state.

    • generatePatientMenuOptions

      public static List<Option> generatePatientMenuOptions()
      Generates a list of menu options for patients, allowing them to view and manage their medical records and appointments.

      The generated options cover various actions for patient interaction, including:

      • Viewing and editing medical records
      • Viewing available appointments and scheduling new ones
      • Rescheduling, canceling, and viewing scheduled appointments
      • Viewing historical appointment outcomes
      Each option sets the appropriate MenuState to handle user navigation.
      Returns:
      A list of Option objects, each representing a different patient action with necessary configurations for menu navigation.

    • getEditBloodTypeOption

      public static Option getEditBloodTypeOption(Patient p)
      Generates an option for editing the blood type of a patient.

      When selected, this option prompts the user to enter a new blood type for the specified patient, updating the patient’s record with the inputted value.

      Parameters:
      p - The patient whose blood type is being edited.
      Returns:
      An option for editing the patient’s blood type, which redirects to the main menu state after updating.

    • getEditMobileNumberOption

      public static Option getEditMobileNumberOption(Patient patient)
      Generates an option for editing the mobile number of a patient.

      This option allows the user to input a new mobile number, updating the patient’s record. The default country code "+65" is prefixed to the current and new numbers.

      Parameters:
      patient - The patient whose mobile number is being edited.
      Returns:
      An option for editing the patient’s mobile number, which exits to the main menu state after updating.

    • getEditHomeNumberOption

      public static Option getEditHomeNumberOption(Patient patient)
      Generates an option for editing the home number of a patient.

      This option allows the user to input a new home number, with the default country code "+65" prefixed to the displayed current and new values.

      Parameters:
      patient - The patient whose home number is being edited.
      Returns:
      An option for editing the patient’s home number, with a redirect to the main menu state upon completion.

    • getEditEmailOption

      public static Option getEditEmailOption(Patient patient)
      Generates an option for editing the email address of a patient.

      Upon selection, this option allows input of a new email address, which is saved to the patient’s record.

      Parameters:
      patient - The patient whose email is being edited.
      Returns:
      An option for editing the patient’s email, redirecting to the medical record view upon completion.

    • getEditAppointmentOption

      public static Option getEditAppointmentOption()
      Creates an option for doctors to edit appointments. Selecting this option redirects the doctor to a menu where they can manage patient appointments.
      Returns:
      An Option for editing appointments, accessible only to doctors.

    • generateEditPatientDetailsOptions

      public static List<Option> generateEditPatientDetailsOptions(Patient p)
      Generates a list of options for editing a patient's details. The available options depend on the user type (doctor or patient):
      • Doctors: Can edit the patient's blood type and have the additional option to edit appointments.
      • Patients: Can only edit their personal contact details: mobile number, home number, and email.
      Each option provides a redirection to the appropriate menu state based on the user type, ensuring that:
      • Doctors are directed to MenuState.DOCTOR_EDIT_PAST_PATIENT after each edit, allowing them to manage multiple details sequentially.
      • Patients are redirected to MenuState.PATIENT_VIEW_MEDICAL_RECORD, allowing them to return to their personal medical record after editing contact details.
      Parameters:
      p - The patient whose details are being edited.
      Returns:
      A list of Option objects representing editable fields based on the user's role.
      See Also:
      • getEditBloodTypeOption(Patient)
      • getEditMobileNumberOption(Patient)
      • getEditHomeNumberOption(Patient)
      • getEditEmailOption(Patient)

    • generateAppointmentDisplayOptions

      public static List<Option> generateAppointmentDisplayOptions(List<Appointment> appointments, MenuCollection.Control ctl)
      Generates a list of options for displaying or editing appointments on the Patient Menu. This method provides a detailed view of each appointment, including appointment timeslot, patient and doctor names, status, and (if available) additional outcome details such as service type and consultation notes.

      The generated options vary based on the provided Control parameter:

      • Display Only: When ctl is Control.NONE, the options provide a read-only display of appointment details.
      • Select Mode: When ctl is Control.SELECT, the options are numbered, allowing users to select an appointment for viewing. Selecting an option redirects to the detailed appointment record.
      Additional actions:
      • A "View Appointment Outcomes" option is added for patients if they are viewing without SELECT access. This redirects to the MenuState.PATIENT_VIEW_OUTCOMES for viewing detailed outcome information.
      Parameters:
      appointments - The list of appointments to be displayed.
      ctl - Specifies whether options are displayed as read-only (Control.NONE) or allow editing (Control.EDIT).
      Returns:
      A list of Option objects representing each appointment's details, with select or view functionality depending on the control type.

    • generateAvailableTimeslotOptionsByDate

      public static List<Option> generateAvailableTimeslotOptionsByDate(Doctor doctor)

    • generateAvailableTimeslotOptions

      public static List<Option> generateAvailableTimeslotOptions(Map<Doctor,List<Timeslot>> timeslotsByDoctor)
      Generates a list of options displaying available timeslots for each doctor, along with their availability. This list is intended to provide an overview of each doctor's schedule with quick availability indicators (ticks and crosses) for each timeslot.

      This option generator performs the following:

      • Collects all unique timeslots across the doctors' schedules to standardize the display.
      • Creates a display option for each doctor, listing their name and marking each unique timeslot as available ("✓") or unavailable ("✗").
      Additionally, an unnumbered "Schedule an Appointment" option is included at the end of the list for users to initiate the scheduling process, redirecting them to MenuState.TIMESLOT_SELECTION_TYPE.
      Parameters:
      timeslotsByDoctor - A map of doctors to their list of available timeslots.
      Returns:
      A list of Option objects, each representing a doctor's availability for each timeslot, with an added scheduling option at the end.

    • generateTimeSlotSelectOptions

      public static List<Option> generateTimeSlotSelectOptions()
      Generates a list of options for selecting a date to schedule an appointment. The options include pre-defined choices for "Today" (if available) and "Tomorrow," as well as a "Custom" option to select any other date.

      This option generator performs the following:

      • If it is before the last available timeslot of the day, includes a "Today" option that automatically sets the date to the current day.
      • Includes a "Tomorrow" option that sets the date to the next day.
      • Includes a "Custom" option allowing the user to manually select a date, leading to MenuState.INPUT_APPOINTMENT_YEAR.
      Each option sets the date fields (year, month, and day) in the formData map for use in subsequent scheduling steps.
      Returns:
      A list of Option objects, each representing a date selection choice.

    • getInputYearOptionGenerator

      public static List<Option> getInputYearOptionGenerator()
      Generates a list of year options for scheduling appointments or specifying unavailability.

      This option generator is shared between patients and doctors:

      • Patients: Used to select the year when adding or rescheduling an appointment.
      • Doctors: Used to select the year when adding or editing unavailability.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing available years.

    • getInputMonthOptionGenerator

      public static List<Option> getInputMonthOptionGenerator(Map<String,Object> formValues)
      Generates a list of month options based on the selected year for scheduling appointments or specifying unavailability.

      This option generator is shared between patients and doctors:

      • Patients: Used to select the month when adding or rescheduling an appointment.
      • Doctors: Used to select the month when adding or editing unavailability.
      Parameters:
      formValues - Contains previously selected year information to determine start month.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing available months within the selected year.

    • getInputHourOptionGenerator

      public static List<Option> getInputHourOptionGenerator(Map<String,Object> formValues)
      Generates a list of hour options for the selected date, allowing patients to set appointment times or doctors to specify unavailability times.

      This option generator is shared between patients and doctors:

      • Patients: Used to select the hour when adding or rescheduling an appointment.
      • Doctors: Used to select the hour when adding or editing unavailability.
      Parameters:
      formValues - Contains the selected year, month, and day to determine available hours.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing available hours within the selected date.

    • getInputDoctorOptionGenerator

      public static List<Option> getInputDoctorOptionGenerator(List<Doctor> availableDoctors, LocalDateTime selectedDateTime)
      Generates a list of options for selecting an available doctor for a patient’s appointment, either to schedule a new appointment or reschedule an existing one.

      This option generator is used by patients to view and select from a list of available doctors for the specified date and time.

      • If rescheduling, it updates the existing appointment with the selected doctor.
      • If scheduling a new appointment, it creates the appointment with the selected doctor.
      Parameters:
      availableDoctors - List of doctors available for the specified date and time.
      selectedDateTime - The chosen date and time for the appointment.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing available doctors, with actions for scheduling or rescheduling.

    • generateUpdateAppointmentOptions

      public static List<Option> generateUpdateAppointmentOptions(List<Appointment> appointments, MenuCollection.Control ctl)
      Generates a list of options for patients to update their appointments by either rescheduling or canceling.

      This option generator is exclusively for patients:

      • If the control type is Control.EDIT, patients can reschedule their appointments by selecting a new timeslot.
      • If the control type is Control.DELETE, patients can cancel their appointment, requiring confirmation.
      Parameters:
      appointments - List of appointments for the patient to manage.
      ctl - Specifies the control type, either Control.EDIT (reschedule) or Control.DELETE (cancel).
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing each appointment, with actions for rescheduling or canceling.

    • generateDoctorMenuOptions

      public static List<Option> generateDoctorMenuOptions()
      Generates a list of menu options for doctors, enabling them to manage patient records, view and update their schedule, and handle appointment requests.

      This menu provides the following options:

      • View Patient's Medical Record: Navigate to a menu for viewing past patients' medical records.
      • Update Patient's Medical Record: Access a menu to update information in a patient’s medical record.
      • View Personal Schedule: View upcoming scheduled events and appointments.
      • Manage Availability: Adjust availability by setting or removing unavailability periods.
      • Accept or Decline Appointment Requests: Review and manage appointment requests from patients.
      • View Upcoming Appointments: View scheduled appointments that are yet to occur and cancel them if required.
      • Record Appointment Outcome: Enter outcomes of past appointments, updating the patient’s record with consultation details.
      Each option transitions the doctor to the appropriate menu state for managing the selected task.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing the various administrative and clinical tasks available to doctors.

    • generatePatientOptions

      public static List<Option> generatePatientOptions()
      Generates a list of options for doctors to view patients under their care, enabling further actions or navigation related to each patient.

      This method retrieves all unique patients associated with the current doctor’s appointments, displaying basic details for each patient. Doctors can:

      • See the patient’s name and ID.
      • Select a patient to navigate to the past appointments view for that patient.
      Each selected option adds the patient to the form data, allowing the doctor to view past appointments upon selection.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing each patient under the doctor’s care, with actions to view their past appointments.

    • generateUpcomingEventControlOptions

      public static List<Option> generateUpcomingEventControlOptions(DoctorMenuCollection.UpcomingEventControl control)
      Generates a list of options for doctors to manage upcoming events and appointments, with actions tailored to the specified control type. This menu supports viewing, adding, editing, and deleting busy timeslots, as well as managing appointment requests.

      This method enables the following actions based on the control parameter:

      • View Busy Timeslots: Display times where the doctor is marked as unavailable.
      • Manage Appointments: Show upcoming appointments, with options to cancel or respond to requests.
      • Edit Busy Timeslots: Allows editing specific busy timeslots, useful for adjusting the doctor’s schedule.
      • Delete Busy Timeslots: Enables removing selected times where the doctor is marked as busy.
      • Add Busy Timeslot: Option to set a new busy timeslot for unavailability.
      • Reset Filters: Allows toggling views between busy timeslots and appointments, and displaying both.
      Each option transitions the user to an appropriate menu state for handling further actions.
      Parameters:
      control - Specifies the type of control action to generate options for, such as viewing, editing, or deleting busy timeslots, or managing appointments.
      Returns:
      A list of Option for managing upcoming events based on the specified control type, including actions for viewing, modifying, and responding to events or appointments.

    • generateAcceptRejectOptions

      public static List<Option> generateAcceptRejectOptions()
      Generates options for doctors to respond to appointment requests, allowing them to either accept or reject each request.

      This method provides the following options:

      • Accept Appointment: Confirms the selected appointment, setting its status to confirmed.
      • Reject Appointment: Cancels the selected appointment, marking it as rejected.
      Each option:
      • Validates the presence of an appointment object in formValues.
      • Transitions to the upcoming appointments view after completion.
      • Requires confirmation before proceeding with the action.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing actions to accept or reject an appointment request.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the appointment is not found in formValues.

    • generateSelectDoctorPastAppointmentOptions

      public static List<Option> generateSelectDoctorPastAppointmentOptions(Patient p, boolean showNullOutcomes, boolean showNonNullOutcomes)
      Generates a list of options for doctors to view, add, and manage past appointment outcomes, allowing toggling between completed and pending outcomes.

      This method enables doctors to:

      • View Appointments: View past confirmed or completed appointments for a specific patient or all patients under their care.
      • Toggle Outcomes: Switch between viewing appointments with existing outcomes and those without, allowing the doctor to manage outcomes as needed.
      • Add Outcomes: Navigate to add a service type and consultation notes for appointments without existing outcomes.
      • View Completed Outcomes: Access appointments that have recorded outcomes for review and editing.
      • Edit Patient Details: Access options to edit the patient’s personal information.
      • Reset Filters: Reset view filters to show all past appointments regardless of outcome status.
      Depending on the flags showNullOutcomes and showNonNullOutcomes, the doctor can:
      • Show Pending Outcomes: View appointments without outcomes, navigating to add details if needed.
      • Show Completed Outcomes: Access appointments with recorded outcomes, allowing for review and potential updates.
      Parameters:
      p - The patient to filter appointments by, or null to include all patients.
      showNullOutcomes - Flag to display appointments without outcomes (pending).
      showNonNullOutcomes - Flag to display appointments with outcomes (completed).
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing the past appointments, with actions to view, add, or toggle outcomes.

    • generateAddMedicationOptions

      public static List<Option> generateAddMedicationOptions(Prescription prescription)
      Generates options to display and manage medication orders within an existing outcome record.

      This method serves both doctors and patients, enabling:

      • Viewing Medication Orders: Displays each medication order associated with the prescription, showing fields such as order ID, medication ID, prescription ID, and quantity.
      • Doctor Actions: Adds an option for doctors to add a new medication order to the existing prescription of the selected outcome record.
      • Patient Navigation: Provides patients with an option to view other outcome records, facilitating a comprehensive review.
      Depending on the role of the user, different options and next menu states are presented:
      • If the user is a doctor, an "Add Medication" option is included, navigating to the add-medication workflow.
      • If the user is a patient, a "View Another Outcome" option is included, allowing the patient to continue viewing related outcomes.
      Parameters:
      prescription - The prescription object containing medication orders linked to an outcome record.
      Returns:
      A list of Option, each representing a medication order, along with role-specific actions for adding or viewing.

    • generateServiceTypeOptions

      public static List<Option> generateServiceTypeOptions()
      Generates a list of options for selecting a service type when starting to add a new outcome record to an appointment. This option generator is used exclusively by doctors to define the service type for a specific appointment outcome.

      The options allow:

      • Displaying available service types as numbered options for selection.
      • Saving the selected service type in form data with the key "serviceType".
      • Navigating to the DOCTOR_ADD_MEDICATION menu state after selecting a service type, where additional details can be specified.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing each available service type for adding to an outcome record.

    • generatePharmacistMenuOptions

      public static List<Option> generatePharmacistMenuOptions()
      Generates a list of menu options for pharmacists, providing quick access to their primary functions.

      This menu includes options for:

      • Viewing appointment outcomes, showing pending items by default.
      • Updating prescriptions based on appointment outcomes.
      • Submitting requests to replenish inventory stock.
      • Viewing the current inventory levels and details.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing the pharmacist's main menu actions, each linked to its appropriate menu state.

    • generatePharmacistOutcomesOptions

      public static List<Option> generatePharmacistOutcomesOptions(List<Appointment> appointments, boolean isUpdate)
      Generates a list of options for pharmacists to view or update appointment outcomes.

      This option generator is used to display appointment outcomes and related prescription details:

      • If isUpdate is true, pharmacists can select an option to update the prescription.
      • If isUpdate is false, options are displayed without further action.
      Each option displays details such as patient ID, doctor ID, the number of medications, prescription status, and consultation notes.
      Parameters:
      appointments - List of appointments for which outcomes are displayed or updated.
      isUpdate - Specifies whether the options are for updating (true) or just displaying (false) outcomes.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing appointment outcomes, with actions for updating or displaying based on isUpdate.

    • generatePharmacistViewOutcomeOptions

      public static List<Option> generatePharmacistViewOutcomeOptions(List<Appointment> appointments, boolean hideCompleted)
      Generates a list of options for pharmacists to view and manage appointment outcomes, including actions to update prescriptions and toggle the visibility of completed (DISPENSED) outcomes.

      This method combines two types of options:

      • Outcome options: Lists appointment outcomes for viewing, generated by generatePharmacistOutcomesOptions.
      • Action options:
        • Update Prescription: Allows pharmacists to navigate to a menu for updating prescriptions.
        • Show/Hide Completed: Toggles visibility of outcomes based on whether their prescriptions have been set to DISPENSED.
      The hideCompleted flag determines if outcomes with a prescription status of DISPENSED are shown or hidden.
      Parameters:
      appointments - List of appointments for which outcomes are displayed.
      hideCompleted - If true, hides outcomes with prescriptions marked as DISPENSED; if false, shows them.
      Returns:
      A combined list of outcome and action Option for viewing and managing appointment outcomes.

    • generatePharmacistUpdatePrescriptionOptions

      public static List<Option> generatePharmacistUpdatePrescriptionOptions(List<Prescription> prescriptions)
      Generates a list of options for pharmacists to update pending prescriptions, displaying key details such as outcome ID, medication count, and prescription status.

      This option generator is used by pharmacists to:

      • View and select prescriptions that are pending updates.
      • Navigate to a detailed view to handle the selected prescription's updates.
      Each option includes details about the prescription, such as the outcome ID, number of medications, and the current status.
      Parameters:
      prescriptions - List of prescriptions available for updating.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing each prescription that can be updated, with actions to navigate to the update menu.

    • getPharmacistHandleStatusOptions

      public static List<Option> getPharmacistHandleStatusOptions(Prescription p)
      Generates a list of options for pharmacists to handle a prescription, including viewing medication orders and updating the prescription status.

      This option generator creates:

      • Medication Order Options: Displays details for each medication order in the prescription, including order ID, medication name, and quantity.
      • Status Options: Provides selectable status options that allow the pharmacist to progress the prescription status beyond its current state.
      The generated options allow pharmacists to view each medication order and update the prescription status.
      Parameters:
      p - The prescription for which medication orders and status options are generated.
      Returns:
      A combined list of Option, starting with medication order details, followed by status update options.

    • generateMedicationOptions

      public static List<Option> generateMedicationOptions(MenuCollection.Control ctl)
      Generates a list of options for selecting medications, tailored to the specific actions allowed for Admins, Pharmacists, and Doctors.

      This option generator provides the following role-based functionalities:

      • Pharmacists: Can select a medication to submit a replenishment request by choosing a medication and specifying the desired quantity. This functionality is accessed with Control.ADD.
      • Admins: Can view and manage the medication inventory. Admins can either select a medication to edit details (using Control.EDIT) or view a list with unnumbered options for adding or editing medications (with Control.NONE).
      • Doctors: Can select medications to add to a patient’s prescription, using Control.ADD.
      The generated options allow:
      • Medication information display for all roles, showing ID, name, stock level, and low alert level.
      • Conditional actions based on the user role and control type.
      Parameters:
      ctl - Specifies the control type, determining if options are for display, replenishment request, or prescription addition.
      Returns:
      A list of medication selection Option, with actions available based on the user's role and control type.

    • generateAdminMainMenuOptions

      public static List<Option> generateAdminMainMenuOptions()
      Generates a list of main menu options for administrators, providing access to user, appointment, and inventory management, as well as viewing requests.

      This option generator allows administrators to:

      • View and manage users, including filtering by role.
      • View and manage appointments.
      • Add new users to the system.
      • View the medication inventory.
      • View submitted requests, such as replenishment requests from pharmacists.
      Each option is linked to a specific menu state to handle the selected action.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing the main menu actions available to administrators.

    • generateAdminAppointmentsView

      public static List<Option> generateAdminAppointmentsView(List<Appointment> appointments)
      Generates a list of options for administrators to view appointment details, including appointment ID, timeslot, patient and doctor information, and the appointment status.

      This option generator provides a detailed view of each appointment, allowing administrators to:

      • See the appointment ID and scheduled timeslot.
      • View the patient’s name associated with each appointment.
      • See the assigned doctor’s name or indicate if no doctor is assigned.
      • Check the current status of the appointment (e.g., pending, completed).
      Each option is displayed in a read-only format.
      Parameters:
      appointments - List of appointments to be displayed.
      Returns:
      A list of display Option representing each appointment's details.

    • generateStaffListView

      public static List<Option> generateStaffListView(List<Staff> sortedUsers, UserService.SortFilter filter, boolean isAsc, MenuCollection.Control ctl)
      Generates a list of options for viewing, sorting, and managing the staff list, tailored for administrators. The generated options allow sorting by various fields (role, gender, age) and control user management actions.

      This method provides the following options:

      • View Staff List: Displays a list of staff members with details including role, ID, name, gender, and age.
      • Sorting Options: Allows sorting the staff list by role, gender, or age in ascending or descending order, based on the specified filter and sorting direction.
      • Management Controls: Based on the control type:
        • Control.EDIT: Allows editing a selected staff member's details.
        • Control.DELETE: Allows deleting a selected staff member, with a confirmation step.
      • Additional Admin Actions: If no specific control is specified, admins are provided with additional options to:
        • ADD: Add a new user to the system.
        • EDIT: Select a user for editing.
        • DEL: Select a user for deletion.
      Parameters:
      sortedUsers - List of sorted staff members to be displayed, filtered based on the specified criteria.
      filter - Specifies the field to sort by (role, gender, or age).
      isAsc - Defines the sorting order; true for ascending, false for descending.
      ctl - Determines the control type for user management actions, either Control.EDIT or Control.DELETE, or none for view-only.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing the staff list view, including sorting and management actions.

    • generateUserFieldsEditOptions

      public static List<Option> generateUserFieldsEditOptions(Staff staff)
      Generates a list of options for editing fields related to a staff member's account, including username, password, name, and gender. Each option allows updating the selected field.

      This option generator is specific to editing Staff objects and cannot be used for editing Patient fields.

      • Username: Displays the current username and allows modification.
      • Password: Displays the masked current password and allows modification.
      • Name: Displays the current name and allows modification.
      • Gender: Displays the current gender and allows modification.
      Each option saves the updated field back to the Staff object and redirects to the main user menu upon completion.
      Parameters:
      staff - The staff member whose fields are being edited.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing editable fields for the specified staff member.

    • getRoleOptions

      public static List<Option> getRoleOptions()
      Generates a list of options for selecting a user role, allowing administrators to specify the type of user to add (e.g., Patient, Doctor, Pharmacist, or Admin).

      Each option represents a role type:

      • Patient: Creates a patient user.
      • Doctor: Creates a doctor user.
      • Pharmacist: Creates a pharmacist user.
      • Admin: Creates an admin user.
      Each option sets the selected role in the form data and navigates to the menu for adding the user's name.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing each available user role.

    • getGenderOptions

      public static List<Option> getGenderOptions()
      Generates a list of options for selecting a user’s gender, allowing administrators to specify the gender of a new user during the registration process.

      Each option corresponds to a gender value from the Gender enum:

      • Displays the gender name as the option title.
      • Sets the selected gender in the form data for further processing.
      Upon selecting a gender, the menu transitions to the date-of-birth entry stage.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing each gender, with actions to save the selection in form data.

    • getBloodTypeOptions

      public static List<Option> getBloodTypeOptions()
      Generates a list of options for selecting a patient’s blood type, enabling administrators to finalize the registration of a new patient with all required attributes.

      Each option corresponds to a blood type from the BloodType enum:

      • Displays the blood type as the option title.
      • Sets the selected blood type in the form data and completes the creation of a new Patient object.
      Selecting a blood type triggers patient creation using previously gathered details and redirects the user to the main user view.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing each blood type, with actions to finalize patient creation.

    • generateMedicationEditOptions

      public static List<Option> generateMedicationEditOptions(Medication medication)
      Generates a list of options for administrators to edit medication properties, specifically stock level and low alert level, within the inventory.

      This option generator allows administrators to:

      • Update Stock: Displays the current stock level and allows modification.
      • Update Low Alert Level: Displays the current low alert threshold and allows modification.
      Each option captures the updated value from user input and saves it to the Medication object, then redirects to the inventory view.
      Parameters:
      medication - The medication item to be edited.
      Returns:
      A list of Option for editing the specified medication's stock and low alert level.

    • getRequestOptions

      public static List<Option> getRequestOptions(MenuCollection.Control ctl)
      Generates a list of options for managing medication replenishment requests from Pharmacists, supporting display, approval, and rejection actions.

      This method enables administrators to:

      • Display Requests: View pending replenishment requests for medications, showing details such as request ID, medication name, quantity, and status.
      • Approve Requests: Set a selected request’s status to approved, marking it for replenishment.
      • Reject Requests: Set a selected request’s status to rejected.
      If Control.NONE is passed, options are displayed only; otherwise, action options for approving or rejecting requests are included.
      Parameters:
      ctl - The control type specifying the allowed actions, such as Control.APPROVE or Control.REJECT.
      Returns:
      A list of Option representing the request display and management options, with actions determined by the control type.
